name: revocable
content:

If an agreement, a law, etc. is revocable, someone can say officially that it is no longer in effect: revocable trust A revocable trust is a popular way of planning for what happens to your assets after your death. They insisted that the licence to the intellectual property should be a revocable one.
More examplesFewer examplesOnce granted, this notice is only revocable with the express consent of the court.A revocable letter of credit was issued.The designation of beneficiaries is revocable by the owner of the assets.
